text: Prompt Level: 12.0 [SEP] Prompt: You haven't heard from your friend recently. Read her email and write a sympathy card. Type in the input box. Write 30-50 words. [SEP] Response: I was so sorry to hear you're in the hospital. My thoughts are with you, and I'm sending you all my love and positive vibes for a speedy recovery. Please know that I'm here for you if you need anything at all, whether it's a listening ear, a distraction, or just someone to check in on you. Don't hesitate to reach out, even if it's just to vent or ask for a favor. You're incredibly strong and resilient, and I have no doubt you'll get through this. Focus on taking care of yourself and following your doctor's advice. [SEP] Correction: I was so sorry to hear you're in the hospital. My thoughts are with you, and I'm sending you all my love and positive vibes for a speedy recovery. Please know that I'm here for you if you need anything at all, whether it's a listening ear, a distraction, or just someone to check in on you. Don't hesitate to reach out, even if it's just to vent or ask for a favor. You're incredibly strong and resilient, and I have no doubt you'll get through this. Focus on taking care of yourself and following your doctor's advice.

Prompt Level: 7.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a summary of no more than 50-60 words about the case. Use the words below. This is a non-graded activity. [SEP] Response: The Chicago Seven Verdict The jury was split. Two defendants were acquitted and five convicted. The convictions were reversed due to bias by the judge and his refusal to permit defense attorneys to question prospective jurors regarding cultural bias. The case was not re-tried. Defendants and defense attorneys were cited for contempt and sentenced to jail but were overturned. The contempt charges were re-tried. Four people were found guilty but not sentenced. [SEP] Correction: The Chicago Seven Verdict The jury was split. Two defendants were acquitted and five convicted. The convictions were reversed due to bias by the judge and his refusal to permit defense attorneys to question prospective jurors regarding cultural bias. The case was not re-tried. Defendants and defense attorneys were cited for contempt and sentenced to jail but were overturned. The contempt charges were re-tried. Four people were found guilty but not sentenced.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: In my experience corporate social responsibility have different styles depend the real objective of the companies. For example actually we work with a mines company in CSR. They use our knowledge to improve the maternal and adolescent health in especially in SRH and GBV in one municipality in the south of Bolivia close the Uyuni Salar flat. For start this colaboration we needed the permission of our cental office in New York. It is because our reputation risks. In my point of view the CSR have for this company two benefits: increase his image like a good partner with the local government and local communities, the second benefit is to prevent protest for its mineral exploitation. In one hand our agreement is and win win model because we have a same objective prevent the maternal mortality in the intervention area. Of course we have a permanent reputation risk and maybe the quantity of money it is not enough. In other words it is to few finantial support to a big reputation risk in front others donors. One goal with out our expectations was that the company enroll one midwife in his health team for this project. I believe in the CSR. They use our knowledge to improve the maternal and adolescent health in especially in SRH and GBVin one municipality in the south of Bolivia close the Uyuni Salar flat. For start this colaboration we needed the permission of our cental office in New York. It is because our reputation risks. In my point of view the CSR have for this company two benefits: increase his image like a good partner with the local government and local communities, the second benefit is to prevent protest for its mineral exploitation. In one handour agreement is and winwin model because we have a same objective prevent the maternal mortality in the intervention area. Of coursewe have a permanent reputation riskand maybe the quantity of money it is not enough. In other wordsit is to few finantial support to a big reputation risk in front others donors. One goal with out our expectations was that the company enroll one midwife in his health team for this project. I believe in the CSR.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: In the mystical landscapes of India, the elusive "Brahmaputra Banshee" is a legendary creature whispered of in hushed tones. Said to inhabit the misty banks of the mighty Brahmaputra River, this ethereal spirit is known for its hauntingly melodic wails that echo through the night, captivating the imagination of those who hear it. Described as a spectral being with flowing silver hair and luminescent skin, the Brahmaputra Banshee is often seen during twilight, when the river is cloaked in a veil of fog. Locals believe that her wails, though eerie, possess a melancholic beauty, telling tales of lost love and forgotten souls. Some say she is the spirit of a princess who drowned in the river centuries ago, forever bound to its waters. Her presence is both feared and revered; while her song is said to bring misfortune, it also serves as a warning of impending floods or natural disasters. Fishermen and villagers along the river offer small tributes to appease her, hoping for safe passage and bountiful catches. The legend of the Brahmaputra Banshee continues to be an integral part of the region's folklore, a mystical reminder of the river’s enduring mysteries. [SEP] Correction: In the mystical landscapes of India, the elusive "Brahmaputra Banshee" is a legendary creature whispered of in hushed tones. Said to inhabit the misty banks of the mighty Brahmaputra River, this ethereal spirit is known for its hauntingly melodic wails that echo through the night, captivating the imagination of those who hear it. Described as a spectral being with flowing silver hair and luminescent skin, the Brahmaputra Banshee is often seen during twilight, when the river is cloaked in a veil of fog. Locals believe that her wails, though eerie, possess a melancholic beauty, telling tales of lost love and forgotten souls. Some say she is the spirit of a princess who drowned in the river centuries ago, forever bound to its waters. Her presence is both feared and revered; while her song is said to bring misfortune, it also serves as a warning of impending floods or natural disasters. Fishermen and villagers along the river offer small tributes to appease her, hoping for safe passage and bountiful catches. The legend of the Brahmaputra Banshee continues to be an integral part of the region's folklore, a mystical reminder of the river’s enduring mysteries.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Dear Harry, Congratulations for your promotion as a Manager. One of the most important aspect of being a successful Manager is to have a high performance team. In this sense, it is important to have the team motivated. A motivated team is a group that normally produces much more than a demotivated team. Also when you motivate a team it is willing to reach higher standards of quality. Consequently, the company benefits from motivated teams. Additionally, there are also clear benefits for each team member because when an individual has a good performance and a high level of excellence in the services or products where he is involved of his professional career will be enhanced by these skills giving him more opportunities to move forward for reaching a promotion. But how can you have a team motivated? There are some key aspects to have into account: - Listen every team member of your team carefully. If each one realize that you are listening honestly and sympathetically to them then you will build trust on your team. - Work with your team on a collaborative way. It is not a micromanagement format it is all about how to help them to reach higher goals with your support. - Recognise their goals in public and reward them. It is not needed to give them more money, sometimes it would be enough with some extra days off, other times a costly and customized training would be more valuable from their perspective to feel rewarded. - Avoid things like: be angry, don’t praise people when they deserve. If you do these things make sure that you will have a demotivated team. Good luck with the challenge of having a motivated team. [SEP] Correction: Dear Harry, Congratulations for your promotion as a Manager. One of the most important aspect of being a successful Manager is to have a highperformance team. In this sense, it is important to have the team motivated. A motivated team is a group that normally produces much more than a demotivated team. Alsowhen you motivate a teamit is willing to reach higher standards of quality. Consequently, the company benefits from motivated teams. Additionally, there are also clear benefits for each team member because when an individual has a good performance and a high level of excellence in the services or products where he is involved of his professional career will be enhanced by these skills giving him more opportunities to move forward for reaching a promotion. But how can you have a team motivated? There are some key aspects to have into account: - Listen every team member of your team carefully. If each one realize that you are listening honestly and sympathetically to them then you will build trust on your team. - Work with your team on a collaborative way. It is not a micromanagement formatit is all about how to help them to reach higher goals with your support. - Recognise their goals in public and reward them. It is not needed to give them more mone, sometimes it would be enough with some extra days off, other timesa costly and customized training would be more valuable from their perspective to feel rewarded. - Avoid things like: be angry, don’t praise people when they deserve. If you do these things make sure that you will have a demotivated team. Good luck with the challenge of having a motivated team.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Among the nine writing techniques introduced, metaphor, symbolism, and questioning stand out as the most useful to me. Metaphor allows for vivid comparisons that breathe life into writing, helping readers connect abstract ideas to tangible imagery. Symbolism, on the other hand, enriches writing by layering deeper meanings beneath the surface, making narratives more engaging and thought-provoking. These techniques are particularly valuable in creative writing, where emotional depth and layered interpretations enhance storytelling. Additionally, questioning serves as a powerful tool to develop ideas and encourage critical thinking. By asking "what if" or "why," writers can push their thoughts further, uncovering fresh perspectives and unexpected angles. This technique is incredibly effective when brainstorming or refining arguments in analytical writing. While free writing and loop writing help generate ideas freely, structured techniques like listing and cubing provide organization, making them useful for planning essays or breaking down complex topics. Each technique has its own strengths, but the most effective ones depend on the writing purpose and style. [SEP] Correction: Among the nine writing techniques introduced, metaphor, symbolism, and questioning stand out as the most useful to me. Metaphor allows for vivid comparisons that breathe life into writing, helping readers connect abstract ideas to tangible imagery. Symbolism, on the other hand, enriches writing by layering deeper meanings beneath the surface, making narratives more engaging and thought-provoking. These techniques are particularly valuable in creative writing, where emotional depth and layered interpretations enhance storytelling. Additionally, questioning serves as a powerful tool to develop ideas and encourage critical thinking. By asking "what if" or "why," writers can push their thoughts further, uncovering fresh perspectives and unexpected angles. This technique is incredibly effective when brainstorming or refining arguments in analytical writing. While free writing and loop writing help generate ideas freely, structured techniques like listing and cubing provide organization, making them useful for planning essays or breaking down complex topics. Each technique has its own strengths, but the most effective ones depend on the writing purpose and style.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: One legendary creature that fascinates me is the Kitsune from Japanese folklore. Kitsune are fox spirits known for their intelligence and magical abilities. They can shape-shift into human form, often appearing as beautiful women. Kitsune are believed to live for centuries, and as they age, they grow more tails, with the most powerful ones having up to nine tails. These creatures are often depicted as tricksters, using their cunning to deceive humans. However, they can also be benevolent, serving as guardians and protectors. Kitsune are associated with the Shinto deity Inari, the god of rice, fertility, and prosperity. Inari's foxes are considered messengers and are often seen at shrines dedicated to this deity. The dual nature of Kitsune—both mischievous and protective—makes them intriguing figures in Japanese mythology. Their stories reflect themes of transformation, wisdom, and the balance between good and evil. Whether as playful tricksters or loyal guardians, Kitsune continue to captivate the imagination and remain a beloved part of Japanese cultural heritage. [SEP] Correction: One legendary creature that fascinates me is the Kitsune from Japanese folklore. Kitsune are fox spirits known for their intelligence and magical abilities. They can shape-shift into human form, often appearing as beautiful women. Kitsune are believed to live for centuries, and as they age, they grow more tails, with the most powerful ones having up to nine tails. These creatures are often depicted as tricksters, using their cunning to deceive humans. However, they can also be benevolent, serving as guardians and protectors. Kitsune are associated with the Shinto deity Inari, the god of rice, fertility, and prosperity. Inari's foxes are considered messengers and are often seen at shrines dedicated to this deity. The dual nature of Kitsune—both mischievous and protective—makes them intriguing figures in Japanese mythology. Their stories reflect themes of transformation, wisdom, and the balance between good and evil. Whether as playful tricksters or loyal guardians, Kitsune continue to captivate the imagination and remain a beloved part of Japanese cultural heritage.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: Think of something weird, exciting or funny that happened to you recently, and describe it in an email to a friend. Make it interesting and descriptive, and remember to check for pronoun reference. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: I picked up Emily Henry’s Beach Read a couple of years ago when I found out she was a fellow Hope College alum, and there were a few references to unique Hope experiences, such as late-night donut adventures. I quickly became a fan. Her storytelling is unmatched and I eagerly await every new release. Last month, when she released Funny Story, I picked it up at my local bookshop that day and finished it within the week! Once again, her one-of-a-kind character building told a story I couldn’t put down. I will give a bit of a disclaimer up front: this book did have a bit more “spice” than I would usually go for, but for me, the storytelling made the read worth it for me. Daphne, a librarian, moved to her fiance Peter’s hometown of Waning Bay, Michigan to start a life together. Daphne adores the way he tells their love story, but their life together comes to a screeching halt when he realizes he’s in love with his childhood best friend Petra. Daphne moves in with Petra’s ex fiance, Miles, so Petra and Peter can move in together, leaving Daphne and Miles to put their lives back together. Despite finding themselves in similar life situations, the newfound roommates couldn’t be more opposite. For example, Miles is neighborly and knows everyone in town while Daphne’s coworkers think she’s a secret agent since no one knows anything about her life. They do their best to coexist and avoid each other in the apartment, but eventually start to form a friendship due to their close quarters. Begrudgingly, Daphne agrees to let Miles show her around town, with a countdown to her eagerly awaited Read-A-Thon (the only thing keeping her in Waning Bay) and an unexpected plan to deceive their exes. Daphne’s job as a librarian means several book references throughout the story, which warms my bookish heart. From a Station Eleven reference to alluding to the author characters from Henry’s Beach Read, these references are a bonus to help the reader illustrate Daphne’s personality based on her literary favorites. Both Daphne and Miles are surprised by unexpected visitors, which brings some bumps in the road for their relationship – and a full apartment which presents its own challenges. Again, their different life paths leave them in a similar situation: putting the pieces together from the relationships that have deeply affected their own stories. One of my favorite quotes which is perfectly descriptive of Daphne and Miles’ relationships with their exes and families, and affects how they view their relationship with each other, is Daphne’s advice on waiting. “You can’t force a person to show up, but you can learn a lesson when they don’t. Trust people’s actions, not their words. Don’t love anyone who isn’t ready to love you back. Let go of the people who don’t hold on to you. Don’t wait on anyone who’s in no rush to get to you.” They also continue finding favorite Waning Bay spots, with their sidekick, Daphne’s cowo [SEP] Correction: I picked up Emily Henry’s Beach Read a couple of years ago when I found out she was a fellow Hope College alum, and there were a few references to unique Hope experiences, such as late-night donut adventures. Prompt Level: 11.0 [SEP] Prompt: Read the blog about a law in Japan, then write about a law in your country. Type in the input box. Write 60-90 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: The Law in our country is against drinking and Driving. If anyone is caught drinking and driving, they are penalised and subject to many other punishments as well. They have to bear the fine and also may be subject to improisenment it the person has drunk a lot. The other passenger also with the drunk driver has to bear the fine of it. They have to bear the fine and also may be subject to improisenment it the person has drunk a lot. The other passenger also with the drunk driver has to bear the fine of it.

Prompt Level: 2.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a paragraph about how your friend stays healthy and in shape. Think of your topic sentence first. Then write other sentences to support the topic sentence examples. Think about questions like: **How often does he/she exercise? What does he/she eat?** Type in the input box. Write 25-50 words. [SEP] Response: My friend always stays healthy and fit. Every morning, before starting work, he goes to the gym. He also eats healthy and nutritious foods. On weekends, he enjoys bike rides and walks in the park. [SEP] Correction: My friend always stays healthy and fit. Every morning, before starting work, he goes to the gym. He also eats healthy and nutritious foods. On weekends, he enjoys bike rides and walks in the park.

Prompt Level: 6.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write an email summarizing a meeting you recently attended. Include details of all questions and answers, and who said what. Also include the action items. If you don't usually go to meetings, make one up. Type in the input box. Write 60-100 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: MEETING NOTES – PROJECT X Attendees:Joana, Carlos, Ana Joana:Project delayed due to supplier issues. Scheduling a meeting with them for Friday (07/05). Carlos:The 10% budget increase has been approved. Ana:Do we need to adjust the timeline? Joana: Yes, but only after the supplier meeting. Action Items: - Joana:Schedule supplier meeting by Wednesday (07/03). - Ana: Update timeline and share revised version by 07/08. - All: Suggest ideas to prevent further delays. Next Meeting: 07/10 at 10 AM. [SEP] Correction: MEETING NOTES – PROJECT X Attendees:Joana, Carlos, Ana Joana:Project delayed due to supplier issues. Scheduling a meeting with them for Friday (07/05). Carlos:The 10% budget increase has been approved. Ana:Do we need to adjust the timeline? Joana: Yes, but only after the supplier meeting. Action Items: - Joana:Schedule supplier meeting by Wednesday (07/03). - Ana: Update timeline and share revised version by 07/08. - All: Suggest ideas to prevent further delays. Next Meeting: 07/10 at 10 AM.

Prompt Level: 11.0 [SEP] Prompt: You are applying for a position as a manager at a major company. Imagine you have extensive business qualifications and experience, and write your cover letter. Read the example cover letter. Type in the input box. Write 45-65 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: I really appreciate your consideration to read my resume I would like to highlight my extensive qualifications and business experience, which I consider to be of great relevance to the position I am seeking in your company. Throughout my career, I have had the opportunity to work in different sectors and businesses, which has provided me with extensive knowledge and understanding of the market and possible strategies for success in our businesses. I have a solid academic background, with specializations in management and administration, which helps develop my analytical and decision-making skills. Furthermore, I constantly stay up to date with market trends and innovations, always seeking to improve my skills and knowledge. My experience in team leadership and negotiations made me able to deal with challenges and complex situations effectively and strategically. Details about my education and experience are in the attached resume. Thank you for considering my application. I hope to hear from you soon. [SEP] Correction: I really appreciate your consideration to read my resume I would like to highlight my extensive qualifications and business experience, which I consider to be of great relevance to the position I am seeking in your company. Throughout my career, I have had the opportunity to work in different sectors and businesses, which has provided me with extensive knowledge and understanding of the market and possible strategies for success in our businesses. I have a solid academic background, with specializations in management and administration, which helps develop my analytical and decision-making skills. Furthermore, I constantly stay up to date with market trends and innovations, always seeking to improve my skills and knowledge. My experience in team leadership and negotiations made me able to deal with challenges and complex situations effectively and strategically. Details about my education and experience are in the attached resume. Thank you for considering my application. I hope to hear from you soon.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: In my nation, the process of purchasing a property and submitting an application for a home loan can be both thrilling and difficult. Finding a house that suits your needs and budget is the first step. Rising property costs in recent years have made it more challenging for first-time buyers to enter the market, particularly in cities. Although property prices vary widely by region, housing has generally become more expensive with few possibilities for reasonably priced residences. After you've located a property, you must fill out a number of forms in order to apply for a house loan. A lot of paperwork, including proof of income, employment history, credit ratings, and other financial data, must be provided during this lengthy procedure. A down payment may also be required by lenders, which can be a major obstacle for some purchasers. For a normal house loan, interest rates are usually between 4 and 6%, though they might vary depending on the state of the economy. Although using a mortgage broker or real estate agent is not necessary, many consumers decide to do so in order to negotiate with lenders and handle the complicated paperwork. While a real estate agent can help you find the ideal property, a mortgage broker can help you get the finest loan conditions. Overall, even though purchasing a home might be a daunting process, it is feasible to obtain a home loan and buy a property with the right planning and expert help. [SEP] Correction: In my nation, the process of purchasing a property and submitting an application for a home loan can be both thrilling and difficult. Finding a house that suits your needs and budget is the first step. Rising property costs in recent years have made it more challenging for first-time buyers to enter the market, particularly in cities. Although property prices vary widely by region, housing has generally become more expensive with few possibilities for reasonably priced residences. After you've located a property, you must fill out a number of forms in order to apply for a house loan. A lot of paperwork, including proof of income, employment history, credit ratings, and other financial data, must be provided during this lengthy procedure. A down payment may also be required by lenders, which can be a major obstacle for some purchasers. For a normal house loan, interest rates are usually between 4 and 6%, though they might vary depending on the state of the economy. Although using a mortgage broker or real estate agent is not necessary, many consumers decide to do so in order to negotiate with lenders and handle the complicated paperwork. While a real estate agent can help you find the ideal property, a mortgage broker can help you get the finest loan conditions. Overall, even though purchasing a home might be a daunting process, it is feasible to obtain a home loan and buy a property with the right planning and expert help.

Prompt Level: 9.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write about a restaurant meal you had recently. What did you eat? Was the food local or organic? Did you have dessert? Make sure that every clause has a subject followed by a verb. Type in the input box. Write 100-120 words. This activity is non-graded. [SEP] Response: I recently went to a cozy local restaurant. I ordered a grilled fish fillet with a side of roasted vegetables. The fish was fresh and tasted amazing. The vegetables were organic and cooked perfectly, with a slight crunch. Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) has become an integral part of modern business practices, reflecting a company's commitment to ethical behavior, sustainable development, and community engagement. The postings on this topic reveal a spectrum of opinions, ranging from enthusiastic support to skeptical criticism.

Proponents argue that CSR initiatives foster a positive public image, enhance customer loyalty, and attract top talent. Companies like Patagonia and Ben & Jerry's are often cited as exemplars, demonstrating that ethical practices can coexist with profitability. These businesses have successfully integrated environmental stewardship and social equity into their core operations, proving that CSR can be a win-win strategy for both the company and society.

Critics, however, contend that CSR is often a facade, a marketing gimmick designed to distract from less savory business practices. They point to instances where companies engage in "greenwashing," promoting environmentally friendly initiatives while continuing harmful practices behind the scenes. This skepticism underscores the need for transparency and accountability in CSR efforts.

In my view, CSR is not just a moral imperative but a strategic necessity in today's interconnected world. Companies wield significant influence and resources, and with that comes the responsibility to contribute positively to society. Effective CSR requires genuine commitment, clear goals, and measurable outcomes. It should be embedded in the company's culture and operations, rather than being treated as an afterthought or a mere public relations tool.

Ultimately, the true measure of CSR's success lies in its impact. When done right, CSR can drive meaningful change, fostering a more sustainable and equitable world while also benefiting the business itself. Therefore, companies should strive to move beyond superficial gestures and embrace CSR as a core component of their identity and strategy. [SEP] Correction: <input>Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) has become an integral part of modern business practices, reflecting a company's commitment to ethical behavior, sustainable development, and community engagement. The postings on this topic reveal a spectrum of opinions, ranging from enthusiastic support to skeptical criticism.

Proponents argue that CSR initiatives foster a positive public image, enhance customer loyalty, and attract top talent. Companies like Patagonia and Ben & Jerry's are often cited as exemplars, demonstrating that ethical practices can coexist with profitability. These businesses have successfully integrated environmental stewardship and social equity into their core operations, proving that CSR can be a win-win strategy for both the company and society.

Critics, however, contend that CSR is often a facade, a marketing gimmick designed to distract from less savory business practices. They point to instances where companies engage in "greenwashing," promoting environmentally friendly initiatives while continuing harmful practices behind the scenes. This skepticism underscores the need for transparency and accountability in CSR efforts.

In my view, CSR is not just a moral imperative but a strategic necessity in today's interconnected world. Companies wield significant influence and resources, and with that comes the responsibility to contribute positively to society. Effective CSR requires genuine commitment, clear goals, and measurable outcomes. It should be embedded in the company's culture and operations, rather than being treated as an afterthought or a mere public relations tool.

Ultimately, the true measure of CSR's success lies in its impact. When done right, CSR can drive meaningful change, fostering a more sustainable and equitable world while also benefiting the business itself. Therefore, companies should strive to move beyond superficial gestures and embrace CSR as a core component of their identity and strategy.</input>

Prompt Level: 15.0 [SEP] Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. [SEP] Response: Learning a new language is a rewarding yet challenging experience. Many language learners face common issues that can hinder their progress. One of the most significant challenges is motivation. Consistency is key in language learning, but maintaining interest over time can be difficult, especially when progress seems slow or when faced with the complexities of grammar and pronunciation. Another issue is the fear of making mistakes. Many learners hesitate to speak because they fear they will sound incorrect or be misunderstood. This fear can lead to a lack of practice, which, in turn, slows down improvement. Overcoming this fear requires a shift in mindset, focusing on communication rather than perfection. Additionally, the learning environment plays a crucial role. Without immersion or constant exposure to the language, learners may struggle to retain vocabulary or develop fluency. This can be particularly challenging for those who do not live in a country where the language is spoken. Language learners must be creative in finding ways to surround themselves with the language, such as through movies, music, or online conversations with native speakers. Lastly, differences in cultural context can be a barrier. Understanding the culture behind a language is essential for full comprehension and communication. Without this understanding, learners might miss out on nuances or idiomatic expressions that are crucial for mastering a language. By addressing these challenges, learners can improve their language skills and stay motivated throughout the journey. Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. [SEP] Response: Among the nine writing techniques introduced, metaphor and symbolism stand out as particularly useful to me. Metaphors allow for vivid and imaginative comparisons, making abstract concepts more relatable and engaging. For instance, describing time as a "thief" can evoke a strong emotional response and convey the fleeting nature of moments. This technique enriches writing by adding layers of meaning and enhancing the reader's experience. Symbolism, on the other hand, imbues objects, characters, or events with deeper significance, often reflecting broader themes. This technique can subtly guide the reader to uncover hidden messages and insights within the text. For example, using a storm to symbolize turmoil or a rose to represent love can create powerful imagery and resonance. Focused free writing is another valuable technique, as it encourages the flow of ideas without the constraints of structure or perfection. This method can help overcome writer's block and generate raw, authentic content that can later be refined. Overall, these techniques—metaphor, symbolism, and focused free writing—are instrumental in crafting compelling narratives that captivate and provoke thought, making them indispensable tools in my writing arsenal. Prompt Level: 7.0 [SEP] Prompt: As there were a few problems with Cessna 123's landing, you have been asked to write a report by your superiors. Write the report below. Write 100 - 150 words. [SEP] Response: On 3.10.2023, Cessna 123 encountered issues during its landing at Turin. The aircraft made a ‘final’ report within 7 kilometers of the runway, as required. However, the runway was obstructed, and the controller issued a "continue" instruction, delaying landing clearance. Despite this, the pilot misinterpreted the instruction as an invitation to land and proceeded without receiving proper clearance. This led to the need for a missed approach to avoid an unsafe landing. During the missed approach, cockpit workload was high, but the pilot effectively communicated the situation by declaring a missed approach. Following the procedure, the aircraft safely vacated the runway after successfully landing on the second attempt. Recommendations for further training on communication during critical phases of flight are advised to avoid similar incidents. Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Hi Harry,

There is a huge difference in a team’s productivity when its members are motivated versus when they are not. Motivation is the driving force behind any employee’s performance, so a good manager should make it a priority. Here are some key strategies to ensure your team stays engaged and motivated:

Set clear objectives together: Collaborate with your employees to define their individual goals and recognize their existing skills.
Establish a reward system: Clear incentives for reaching milestones will naturally increase competition and make the team more dynamic.
Recognize their efforts: Praise employees when they do a good job—it boosts morale and reinforces positive behavior.
Build strong relationships: Organize team-building activities to create a comfortable and trusting environment.
Encourage participation: Ask for their opinions and involve them in decisions so they feel valued and part of the company.
At the same time, it’s important to avoid behaviors that demotivate employees. A common mistake is showing disrespect simply because you hold a leadership position. Respect and appreciation go a long way in building a motivated and high-performing team.

Best regards,
Fadila [SEP] Correction: <input>Hi Harry,

Key aspects of celebrity criticism: Personal life: Critics may scrutinize a celebrity's relationships, substance abuse issues, legal troubles, or family dynamics, sometimes considering their private life as a reflection of their character. Public image: A celebrity's persona, particularly if perceived as carefully curated or inauthentic, can be a target for criticism, with accusations of being "too perfect" or not being true to themselves. Social and political stances: When celebrities express strong opinions on social or political issues, they can face backlash from those who disagree with their views, especially if seen as opportunistic or uninformed. Artistic performance: Actors, musicians, and other performers can be criticized for their acting skills, musical quality, or creative choices, with critiques focusing on technical aspects or the overall artistic direction. Impact on society: Some criticism focuses on the potential negative influence a celebrity might have on their fans, particularly regarding body image, consumerism, or unhealthy behaviors. Examples of celebrity criticism: "Cancel culture": A recent trend where celebrities face intense public backlash and potential career consequences for past actions or statements considered offensive or harmful. "Unrealistic portrayals": Actors might be criticized for perpetuating unrealistic beauty standards or lifestyle expectations through their roles. "Hypocrisy": When a celebrity promotes a certain lifestyle or ethical values while engaging in behavior that contradicts those values. Important considerations: Privacy concerns: While celebrities often put themselves in the public eye, there are limits to what aspects of their personal life should be subject to criticism. Constructive criticism: Criticism can be valuable when it focuses on specific areas of improvement or raises important issues, rather than simply being personal attacks. Media bias: The way the media portrays a celebrity can influence public perception and sometimes lead to unfair or exaggerated criticism. [SEP] Response: Developing leadership skills is an ongoing process that involves self-awareness, practice, and a willingness to learn. Some of the most important qualities for a good leader are empathy, effective communication, responsibility, and vision. For example, an empathetic leader can understand the needs of the team and create a more collaborative environment, while good communication avoids potential misunderstandings and aligns the group's goals. Accountability is essential: when a leader admits mistakes and seeks solutions, he or she inspires trust. Vision, on the other hand, allows the leader to motivate his or her team toward clear and meaningful goals. An example of this would be a manager who identifies an employee's talent and offers them opportunities for growth, contributing to the development of both. I believe that everyone has the potential to become a good leader, as long as they are willing to work on their skills and overcome the challenges that arise along the way. Leadership is not a gift that is born with, but rather a set of behaviors and attitudes that can be learned and improved over time. [SEP] Response: Leonardo DiCaprio has long positioned himself as a champion of environmental causes, using his platform to raise awareness of issues like climate change and deforestation. However, his pious posturing often rings hollow when compared to his personal lifestyle. While he endorses sustainability, he continues to travel the world in private jets and luxury yachts, burning more fossil fuels in a single trip than the average person does in a year. This glaring double standard undermines his credibility and raises questions about whether he genuinely cares about the environment or simply enjoys being seen as its savior. Like many media-savvy celebrities, DiCaprio knows how to nourish a belief in his own virtue, carefully curating an image of activism while still earning big bucks from high-paying Hollywood deals and partnerships. Meanwhile, ordinary people are expected to make sacrifices - cutting meat, reducing flights, and consuming less -while he continues to live extravagantly. Someone needs to take him down a peg or two and remind him that real change requires action, not just well-crafted speeches. If he truly wants to emulate a model of sustainability, he should start by practicing what he preaches. Otherwise, people will begin to bad-mouth his so-called activism for what it really is - hypocrisy dressed as heroism. Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: The concept of celebrity itself warrants scrutiny. While fame may stem from genuine talent or accomplishment, the nature of modern celebrity often emphasizes superficial qualities over substance. Celebrities, at times, are placed on pedestals based solely on their curated online personas, rather than on meaningful contributions to society. This can create unrealistic ideals that influence public perception, especially among younger audiences, encouraging materialism and unattainable beauty standards. Furthermore, the media’s relentless focus on the private lives of celebrities perpetuates a culture that values voyeurism over genuine engagement. For example, the obsession with their relationships, controversies, or fashion choices often overshadows their artistic or professional endeavors. In this way, the celebrity phenomenon can detract from promoting individuals who achieve remarkable feats in science, education, or social activism. That said, many celebrities use their platform to advocate for important causes, showing that fame can be leveraged for positive change. Yet, the fixation on stardom raises the question: Should society shift its focus from idolizing fame to celebrating the unsung heroes who truly make a difference? The answer may lie in recalibrating our values and finding inspiration in those who influence the world behind the spotlight. [SEP] Correction: The concept of celebrity itself warrants scrutiny. While fame may stem from genuine talent or accomplishment, the nature of modern celebrity often emphasizes superficial qualities over substance. Celebrities, at times, are placed on pedestals based solely on their curated online personas, rather than on meaningful contributions to society. This can create unrealistic ideals that influence public perception, especially among younger audiences, encouraging materialism and unattainable beauty standards. Furthermore, the media’s relentless focus on the private lives of celebrities perpetuates a culture that values voyeurism over genuine engagement. For example, the obsession with their relationships, controversies, or fashion choices often overshadows their artistic or professional endeavors. In this way, the celebrity phenomenon can detract from promoting individuals who achieve remarkable feats in science, education, or social activism. That said, many celebrities use their platform to advocate for important causes, showing that fame can be leveraged for positive change. Yet, the fixation on stardom raises the question: Should society shift its focus from idolizing fame to celebrating the unsung heroes who truly make a difference? Newspapers and TV broadcasts provided daily updates on news, while magazines offered in-depth articles and features. These forms of media often required readers to set aside specific times for consumption. However, with the rise of the internet, social media platforms, and digital news outlets, my media consumption habits have shifted. Today, I primarily use my smartphone and laptop to access news, videos, and social media platforms. Apps like Twitter, Instagram, and YouTube have become my main sources of information and entertainment, offering content in real-time and tailored to my interests. This shift has greatly impacted my reading habits: instead of long-form articles, I now prefer quick, digestible updates or videos. While this has made access to information faster and more interactive, it has also reduced my attention span for more detailed, traditional reading. Marina Beach, one of the longest urban beaches in the world, provides a tranquil escape from the city's hustle and bustle. Both cities, though different in essence, highlight the diverse beauty of India. Despite its controversies, NAFTA remains a key milestone in the history of international trade agreements. Prompt Level: 11.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a paragraph about how media has changed in your lifetime. What media was important before? What do you use now, and how has it changed your reading habits? Pay attention to your use of commas, colons and semicolons. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: In the past, traditional media such as newspapers, magazines, and television were the most important sources of information and entertainment. I remember reading printed newspapers for local news and watching scheduled TV programs for global updates. These forms of media required patience and dedicated time, creating a routine around consuming information. Recently, the internet has revolutionized the way we engage with media: online platforms, social media, and streaming services have taken center stage. Now, I primarily rely on my smartphone to read news articles, scroll through social media feeds, and watch on-demand videos. This shift has made information more accessible and instant, but it has also changed my reading habits. Instead of reading long-form articles in newspapers, I skim through headlines or short summaries online. Lastly, the rise of e-books and audiobooks has further influenced how I consume content, as I now read and listen to books on digital devices. While these advancements have made media more convenient, they have also introduced challenges, such as information overload and reduced focus on in-depth reading. After years of negotiation, it officially came into force in January 1994. NAFTA’s primary objective was to reduce or eliminate customs duties among the member states, thereby fostering increased trade and economic cooperation. NAFTA has significantly impacted trade relations, especially in the agricultural sector. For instance, it has facilitated the flow of Mexican fruits and vegetables into the US market, benefiting both producers and consumers. The agreement has had both positive and negative effects on its members. While it has boosted trade and economic growth, it has also faced criticism for contributing to job losses in certain industries and raising environmental concerns. Despite these challenges, NAFTA has overall been beneficial to all three member countries, enhancing economic integration and cooperation across North America. It has created a more interconnected and competitive regional market, leading to increased investment and innovation. The agreement has also paved the way for further economic collaboration and development among the United States, Canada, and Mexico. Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: Buying a home and applying for a home loan in my country can be both exciting and challenging. The process generally involves several steps and requires careful planning. One of the first things you need to do is find a suitable property, which often means working with a real estate agent. Although it’s not mandatory, most buyers prefer to use an agent because they help navigate the market, arrange property viewings, and handle negotiations. When it comes to applying for a home loan, there are quite a few forms to fill out. Lenders require detailed information about your identity, income, employment, savings, and credit history. You need to provide documents such as pay slips, tax returns, bank statements, and proof of residency. The paperwork can be time-consuming, but it’s necessary to prove your ability to repay the loan. Housing prices vary widely depending on the location. In big cities and popular areas, homes tend to be very expensive, which makes it difficult for first-time buyers to enter the market. Interest rates for home loans fluctuate with the economy but generally range from 6% to 10% per year. Some people also choose to work with a mortgage broker, who can help find the best loan options and rates from different lenders. Overall, buying a home involves a significant financial commitment and requires patience, but with the right support and preparation, it is achievable. [SEP] Correction: Buying a home and applying for a home loan in my country can be both exciting and challenging. The process generally involves several steps and requires careful planning. Interest rates for home loans fluctuate with the economy but generally range from 6% to 10% per year. Overall, buying a home involves a significant financial commitment and requires patience, but with the right support and preparation, it is achievable.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Motivating employees requires a thoughtful and respectful approach. Start by offering meaningful incentives that connect their personal success to the company’s achievements. When employees feel that their hard work contributes to something bigger—and that they’ll be rewarded for it—they’re more likely to stay engaged. Supporting their career growth through training opportunities and mentorship shows that you’re invested in their future, not just their output. Encouraging a healthy work-life balance and listening to their concerns also builds trust and loyalty. Equally important is how you treat your team: respect, fairness, and recognition go a long way. On the flip side, certain behaviors can quickly demotivate staff. Disrespecting subordinates, taking credit for their work, losing your temper, unfairly shifting blame, or failing to acknowledge good performance can all damage morale. Leaders who avoid these pitfalls and lead with empathy and integrity create a more motivated, productive, and loyal team. The key is to lead by example and value your people. [SEP] Correction: Motivating employees requires a thoughtful and respectful approach. Start by offering meaningful incentives that connect their personal success to the company’s achievements. When employees feel that their hard work contributes to something bigger—and that they’ll be rewarded for it—they’re more likely to stay engaged. Supporting their career growth through training opportunities and mentorship shows that you’re invested in their future, not just their output. Encouraging a healthy work-life balance and listening to their concerns also builds trust and loyalty. Equally important is how you treat your team: respect, fairness, and recognition go a long way. On the flip side, certain behaviors can quickly demotivate staff. Disrespecting subordinates, taking credit for their work, losing your temper, unfairly shifting blame, or failing to acknowledge good performance can all damage morale. Leaders who avoid these pitfalls and lead with empathy and integrity create a more motivated, productive, and loyal team. The key is to lead by example and value your people.

Prompt Level: 7.0 [SEP] Prompt: Your boss has sent you an email, asking you to prepare a presentation about the company. Read the email and draft a speech. I’m thrilled to welcome you to Frisko Shipping! It all started in 2001 with our founder, Bill Frisko, who was inspired to create this company after a wild, near-death experience—you’ll want to hear this one! Once, he fell off a boat, got bitten by a shark, and was ultimately saved by a passing ship. That moment made him realize the potential of the shipping industry, and here we are today.

Frisko Shipping has grown far beyond that initial vision. Now, we’re in 20 cities across the globe, with more than 5,000 dedicated employees. Last year alone, we reached a remarkable profit of 5 million dollars, holding 10% of the global market. These numbers aren’t just statistics—they’re proof of the energy and dedication that drive us every day.

And as you join us, we’re counting on you to bring the same motivation and enthusiasm that have powered Frisko’s growth. To get a sense of where we stand, let’s start with a short quiz to see how much you already know about the company.

I’ll leave you with a thought: if a single experience can inspire a business like this, think about the potential you bring. You never know when a moment or idea might spark the next big step for Frisko. So, let’s dive in and make waves together!

Welcome aboard! [SEP] Correction: <input>Good afternoon, everyone,

Prompt Level: 15.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: New York City is a bustling metropolis that never sleeps, offering a vibrant energy and diverse cultural experiences. From the iconic skyline dominated by skyscrapers to the bustling streets filled with tourists and locals alike, the city exudes an electrifying atmosphere. Central Park provides a serene escape from the urban chaos, while Broadway offers world-class entertainment. The culinary scene is a melting pot of flavors, reflecting the city's multicultural population. Public transportation is convenient, making it easy to explore the city's numerous attractions. In contrast, Kyoto, Japan, is a city where history and tradition are cherished. Known for its stunning temples and tranquil gardens, Kyoto offers a more peaceful and reflective experience. The city embodies a slower pace, allowing visitors to immerse themselves in its rich heritage. Traditional tea ceremonies and kimono-clad locals contribute to the unique cultural ambiance. Unlike New York's towering buildings, Kyoto is characterized by low-rise architecture that harmonizes with nature. The culinary experience here is centered around seasonal ingredients and refined Japanese cuisine. While New York City dazzles with its modernity and fast-paced lifestyle, Kyoto captivates with its historical charm and serene beauty. Each city offers a unique experience, appealing to different preferences and providing unforgettable memories. Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Robots are being increasingly used in various sectors in my country, from healthcare to manufacturing and even service industries. In hospitals, robots assist with surgeries, offering precision and reducing recovery times for patients. In manufacturing, robots handle repetitive and dangerous tasks, improving efficiency and safety. Robots are also making their way into homes, with smart home assistants and cleaning robots becoming more common. While I’m fascinated by the potential of robots to revolutionize industries, I also have mixed feelings about their impact on society. On the positive side, robots can take on tasks that are hazardous to humans, improve productivity, and allow for advancements in medicine and technology. They could also provide solutions to labor shortages and assist in eldercare, as they are increasingly designed to offer companionship and support. However, the rise of robots also poses challenges, such as job displacement, especially in manual labor sectors, and the potential for increased social isolation. The key will be finding a balance between harnessing the benefits of robots and addressing their societal impacts responsibly. Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a trade deal between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, created to promote free trade across North America. Signed in 1992 and implemented in 1994, the agreement aimed to eliminate tariffs and quotas between the three countries, making it easier to trade goods and services. One major benefit of NAFTA was the boost to trade. It opened new markets, reduced the cost of goods, and created jobs, especially in manufacturing. However, it also faced criticism. Many argued that it led to job losses, particularly in the U.S. and Canada, as companies moved production to Mexico due to lower labor costs. Additionally, some criticized NAFTA for not addressing environmental and labor issues enough. In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which introduced updates and improvements to the deal, including better labor protections and environmental standards, aiming to modernize trade relations and address previous concerns. [SEP] Correction: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a trade deal between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, created to promote free trade across North America. Signed in 1992 and implemented in 1994, the agreement aimed to eliminate tariffs and quotas between the three countries, making it easier to trade goods and services. One major benefit of NAFTA was the boost to trade. It opened new markets, reduced the cost of goods, and created jobs, especially in manufacturing. However, it also faced criticism. Many argued that it led to job losses, particularly in the U.S. and Canada, as companies moved production to Mexico due to lower labor costs. Additionally, some criticized NAFTA for not addressing environmental and labor issues enough. In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which introduced updates and improvements to the deal, including better labor protections and environmental standards, aiming to modernize trade relations and address previous concerns.

[SEP] Response: An airplane is composed of several key parts, each with a specific function that ensures safe and efficient flight. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane, housing the cockpit, passengers, and cargo. It provides structural integrity and connects all other parts of the aircraft. The wings are crucial for flight, generating lift as air flows over and under them. This lift allows the airplane to rise off the ground and stay airborne. The shape and design of the wings are essential for controlling the aircraft's stability and maneuverability. The tail consists of the horizontal stabilizer and the vertical stabilizer. The horizontal stabilizer helps maintain the airplane's pitch, preventing it from tipping forward or backward. The vertical stabilizer, or fin, keeps the airplane's yaw in check, preventing it from swaying side to side. Finally, the engines provide the necessary thrust to propel the airplane forward. They can be jet engines or propellers, depending on the type of aircraft. The engines' power allows the airplane to reach and maintain the desired speed and altitude. On the second night, Jane decided to take a walk around the property, while I stayed inside with a book. She returned an hour later, pale as a sheet. Apparently, she had found an old, abandoned graveyard hidden behind the trees. It wasn’t on any of the maps, and there was something unnervingly off about the place—an eerie stillness, like the air itself was holding its breath. But here’s the kicker: As Jane walked away from the graveyard, she swore she saw a figure standing at the edge of the trees—faint, but undeniably there. She rushed back to the cabin and refused to go near that spot again. Ever since, she’s convinced she’s a magnet for ghosts, and now, every time we go on a trip, she packs a "ghost-hunting kit." It seems like Jane's accidental brush with the paranormal turned her into a full-blown enthusiast—if only she'd known what she was getting into! Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Dear Harry, Congratulations on your new role! Motivating a team is both an art and a science, and the best managers know how to balance encouragement with clear expectations. One of the most effective ways to inspire your team is by fostering a positive and supportive work environment. Recognizing individual and group achievements—both big and small—helps boost morale and reinforces good performance. Encouraging open communication ensures that your team feels heard and valued. Set clear, achievable goals and provide the necessary resources for success. Most importantly, lead by example—your enthusiasm and commitment will set the tone for the team. However, there are strategies to avoid. Micromanaging can diminish confidence and stifle creativity. A lack of transparency or inconsistent communication can lead to confusion and disengagement. Setting unrealistic expectations can frustrate employees and lower motivation. Also, neglecting team-building efforts can weaken collaboration and trust. By focusing on empowerment, clarity, and support, you'll cultivate a motivated and high-performing team. Wishing you success in your leadership journey! Set clear, achievable goals and provide the necessary resources for success. Most importantly, lead by example—your enthusiasm and commitment will set the tone for the team. However, there are strategies to avoid. Micromanaging can diminish confidence and stifle creativity. A lack of transparency or inconsistent communication can lead to confusion and disengagement. Setting unrealistic expectations can frustrate employees and lower motivation. Also, neglecting team-building efforts can weaken collaboration and trust. By focusing on empowerment, clarity, and support, you'll cultivate a motivated and high-performing team. Wishing you success in your leadership journey!

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is an important topic in today's business world. The debate is about how companies should care about society's welfare as well as making profits, or if they should focus only on making money for their shareholders. Supporters of CSR say that companies have a big impact on the communities where they operate. By adopting sustainable practices and offering fair benefits to employees, companies not only secure their future but also help society. For example, companies with strong CSR initiatives often enjoy greater customer loyalty, which leads to better financial performance. This relationship between busines and society shows the importance of CSR in creating a positive corporate image. However, critics of CSR argue that the main responsibility of a business is to its shareholders. They say that the resources spent on CSR could be better used in activities that directly increase profits. Additionally, some believe that CSR initiatives are often superficial, serving more as marketing tools than genuine efforts to make a difference. Despite these criticisms, the benefits of CSR cannot be ignored. While it is true that businesses must remain profitable, integrating CSR into their core strateges can lead to sustainable growth. Companies that ignore social expectations risk damaging their reputation and losing consumer trust. Moreover, CSR initiatives can drive innovation and open new markets, benefiting both the company and society. While they are primarily water creatures, they do on occasion venture onto land. They have a dish in their head which must be filled with water at all times. [SEP] Response: The free writing technique is a valuable tool for developing creativity, overcoming writers block and enhancing flow of ideas. By allowing writers to write continuously without worrying about grammar, punctuation, or structure, free writing encourages the mind to explore thoughts freely and organically. This process often leads to unexpected insights, new perspectives, and original ideas that might not emerge under more restrictive writing conditions. It removes the fear of making mistakes and helps silence the inner critic, which can often hinder the creative process. Moreover, free writing serves as a warm-up exercise that gets the brain engaged before starting more structured writing tasks. It helps writers discover their voice and develop confidence in their expression. For students and professionals alike, it can be particularly useful in brainstorming, drafting, or simply breaking through periods of mental stagnation. By cultivating a habit of free writing, individuals can improve their overall writing fluency. Overall, the technique supports both personal expressions and skill development, making it a powerful tool for writers of all levels. It would be the last time we would see each other and by the end of that evening I was deeply shaken. But more lasting and more unsettling than this has been the feeling of loss without his friendship. It was a sudden ending but it was also an ending that lasted for me well beyond that evening. I have worried since then at what kind of friend I am to my friends, and why a friendship can suddenly self-destruct while others can so unexpectedly bloom. My friend and I were used to going to dinner together, though it had become an increasingly tricky matter for us. We had been seeing each other more infrequently, and our conversations had been tending towards repetition. I still enjoyed his passion for talk, his willingness to be puzzled by life’s events, our comically growing list of minor ailments as we entered our sixties, and the old stories he fell back on — usually stories of his minor triumphs, such as the time his car burst into fire, was declared a write-off by insurance, and ended in an auction house where he bought it back with part of the insurance payout and only minor repairs to be made. There were stories of his time as a barman in one of Melbourne’s roughest pubs. I suppose in a lot of long-lasting friendships it is these repeated stories of the past that can fill the present so richly. One of the most common issues language learners face is fear of making mistakes. Many students feel embarrassed when speaking, which can limit their progress and confidence. Pronunciation and grammar rules also present difficulties, especially when they differ significantly from the learner's native language. Another major challenge is vocabulary retention. Even after learning new words, it’s easy to forget them without frequent practice. This is especially true when learners don’t have enough opportunities to use the language in real-life situations. Lack of immersion or exposure to native speakers can make it harder to improve listening and speaking skills. Additionally, motivation plays a big role. Some students feel discouraged if they don’t see quick results, especially when progress seems slow. To overcome these obstacles, learners need consistent practice, supportive learning environments, and tools like language apps or conversation partners. Setting small, achievable goals can also help students stay motivated and track their progress. Despite these challenges, language learning is a rewarding experience that opens doors to new cultures and opportunities. With patience and the right strategies, learners can overcome their fears and become more confident speakers. [SEP] Correction: Learning a new language is both exciting and challenging. In many cases, they are admired not for their achievements, but for their wealth, appearance, or social media presence. It is particularly concerning that individuals with minimal talent or expertise are elevated to a status where their opinions—often uninformed or superficial—carry more weight than those of actual professionals. Furthermore, celebrity culture promotes unrealistic ideals and materialism, especially among young people. The constant display of luxury lifestyles fosters a culture of comparison, which can be damaging to mental health and self-esteem. What’s more, when celebrities are praised excessively for minor acts of kindness or “relatable” behavior, it reveals just how distorted our standards have become. In short, while admiration can be justified in certain cases, the cult of celebrity often distracts us from more meaningful contributions in fields like science, education, or activism. It’s high time we re-evaluate who we celebrate and why. Until we stop glorifying fame for its own sake, we risk losing sight of what truly deserves recognition in our society. [SEP] Response: Property and Liability Insurance Assessment Falling Bricks: The primary hazard is the potential for loose bricks to fall, causing injury to people or damage to property. Potential for Falling Objects: Other falling objects, like debris from mortar or other materials associated with loose bricks, should also be considered. Structural Integrity: Loose bricks may indicate a broader structural issue, potentially increasing the risk of further damage. Severity: Evaluate the potential impact of falling bricks, considering factors like: Height of bricks: Higher bricks increase the potential for significant impact and injury. Brick material: Bricks made of heavier materials pose a higher risk. Location of bricks: Bricks located near pathways, windows, or open areas increase the likelihood of someone being struck. Condition of bricks: Evaluate the looseness of the bricks and how long they have been loose. Weather conditions: Evaluate the impact of wind, rain, and temperature on the bricks. Structural integrity: If the wall has a history of issues, this increases the likelihood of falling bricks. Property Liability Insurance: Property owners are often covered for liability claims if someone is injured on their property, including injuries caused by falling bricks. Duty of Care: Owners have a duty to maintain their property and ensure it is safe for others. Failure to address loose bricks could lead to liability claims. Negligence: If an owner knew or should have known about the loose bricks and failed to address them, they could be found liable for damages. Warning Signs: If repairs are not feasible or immediate, warning signs can be used to alert people to the potential hazard. Regular Inspections: Regular inspections of the exterior can help identify and address loose bricks before they become a significant hazard. Prompt Level: 7.0 [SEP] Prompt: Summarize the report, using your own words. Write 8-10 lines. Compare your text with the model. [SEP] Response: Flight 293, landed at San Francisco International Airport , with the nose wheels cocked at 90 degrees.Airways was operating the airplane as a scheduled domestic passenger flight. The captain, first officer, four flight attendants, and 141 passengers were not injured. The captain noted no problems during the initial departure, and observed a positive rate of climb. The flight crew noted an error message displayed on the control board. There was a fault message for a nose landing gear shock absorber. The data indicated that the gear handle was positioned to the down position, and there was an error message of a fault for the nose wheel steering. The flight diverted to San Jose, California. The captain was asked to perform a flyby of the tower for verification on the gear status. The tower, InterStar ground personnel, and a local news helicopter advised him that the nose gear was cocked 90 degrees to the left. When he found out this information, the captain decided to divert to SFO because it had optimum field conditions, a longer runway, and a better emergency support services. The crew flew for several hours to burn fuel so that they could land at a lighter weight. The captain advised the cabin crew that in the event that the nose gear collapsed, evacuation from the front doors was not available so everyone would deplane from the rear exits. The flight crew continually updated the cabin crew and passengers about the situation, and advised the cabin crew to prepare for emergency procedures. The captain flew the airplane for the landing. He touched down at 120 knots, and applied normal braking at 90 knots. He held the nose gear off of the ground as long as possible. At 60 knots, the flight crew shut down the engines. They did not use reverse thrust or auto-braking. During the landing, the forward cabin crew could smell burnt rubber. The air traffic control tower confirmed that there was no fire, and the captain announced this to the cabin crew. After this notification, the passengers deplaned normally using an air stair. Upon touchdown, the tires rapidly deflated and tore apart, and both wheels were worn into the axle. During landing, the airplane's trajectory was not affected by the abnormal configuration or subsequent tire destruction, and the airplane stayed on the runway centerline. I’ve completed the risk assessment for your secondhand clothes shop, and I can see why your insurance quotes have been high. There are several issues that need attention to reduce your risk and premiums.

Outside, there are loose bricks and blocked drainpipes that could cause accidents or water damage, so it’s important to repair these and clear them out. The leaky roof should also be fixed to prevent damage to your stock and the building. Keeping the yard and sidewalk clear of clutter will reduce the risk of slips and trips for customers.

Inside, poor lighting needs to be improved to prevent accidents and theft, and boxes should not be stacked unsafely as this can cause injuries. It’s essential to replace the old fire extinguishers with functioning ones and store loose chemicals properly to reduce fire hazards and health risks.

Making these changes will not only improve safety for your customers and staff but should also help lower your property and liability insurance costs.

Let me know if you need help prioritizing these tasks.

Best,
Juvenal Cárdenas [SEP] Correction: <input>Hi Garate,

Nagas play a significant role in various myths and legends. They are considered protectors of treasures and sacred places, and are often associated with fertility and prosperity. In addition to their protective nature, Nagas can also be vengeful if disrespected or harmed. This duality makes them fascinating and complex figures in Indian folklore. Temples dedicated to Nagas can be found throughout India, where devotes offer prayers and rituals to seek their blessings and protection.
